oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Estimate of funds required for the service of the Quartermaster's Department at Nashville by W. A. Wainwright

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wainwright, William Alonzo, 1832-1904; United States -- Army -- Quartermaster Corps; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page printed form lists categories providing a good indication of the diverse responsibilities of the Quartermasters Department. One item of interest listed under "Incidental Expenses (not expressed under any other heading): "Extra duty men at Genl. Sherman's Hdqrs. [cost] 400.00."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the Civil War the Quartermaster's Department under the leadership of Montgomery C. Meigs provided supplies for the half-million men in the Union Army, ran the Army's first major depot system, and transported unprecedented levels of supplies and personnel. In 1862 the Quartermaster Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries.
